Topic.Title: Wind turbines sold as environmentally friedly killing thousands of birds including Golden Eagles

Message.Msg: Currently I have farming interests in the State of Kansas and we have a wind energy lease offered to the family partnership overseeing the operation of the farm. A large BPAE(British Petroleumm Alternative Energy) wind energy project is underway and it must conform to the requirements of the State which include the permission of the State Game department which has responsibility for game and non game birds in the state. They will allow the request from BPAE because avion loss to wind turbines is virtually nonexistent in this area. All you have to do is walk among the existing adjacent BPAE turbines (about 300 turbines) to see that there aren't any bird carcasses lying around

Topic.Title: So, Our Economy Is In A Depression And "Crock" Market Is At New Highs?

Message.Msg: No matter how you look at it, it's a HOAX. How much are you getting in your savings account? On your CD? People are being coaxed (and hoaxed) into investing in the crock market with the expectation of a higher yield. That works in the short term when people pile in, then they're happy they make a few bucks, but when it crashes it comes down hard - and people will get hurt. Look at Apple - once most everyone had anything beginning with "i" the stock tanked because it cannot possibly grow at the same rate. Same with the stock market - except the inside traders on Wall Street will be the first ones out, and make the suckers' money on the way down, too. Just wonderful, huh? The rich get richer at the poor and the middle class's expense.

Message.Title: Win 8 market share reached 4.2%
Message.Msg: News out today from Softpedia that Windows 8 finally reached market share of 4.1%. Windows Blue is already boosting Windows 8’s success, according to figures provided by StatCounter for the week of March 24, as the new Microsoft operating system is quickly increasing its market share. Windows 8 has finally reached a 4.12 percent market share, becoming the fifth most popular operating system in the world and overtaking the iOS platform.
